Events.year: 1099 – Some 15,000 starving Christian soldiers begin the siege of Jerusalem by marching in a religious procession around the city as its Muslim defenders watch.
Events.html: 1099 – Some 15,000 starving Christian soldiers begin the siege of Jerusalem by marching in a religious procession around the city as its Muslim defenders watch.

Events.year: 1283 – Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta.
Events.html: 1283 – Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta.

Events.year: 1497 – Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.
Events.html: 1497 – Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.

Events.year: 1579 – Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.
Events.html: 1579 – Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.

Events.year: 1592 – Imjin War: At the Battle of Hansan Island, the Korean Navy, led by Yi Sun-sin, Yi Eok-gi, and Won Gyun, decisively defeats the Japanese Navy, led by Wakisaka Yasuharu.
Events.html: 1592 – Imjin War: At the Battle of Hansan Island, the Korean Navy, led by Yi Sun-sin, Yi Eok-gi, and Won Gyun, decisively defeats the Japanese Navy, led by Wakisaka Yasuharu.

Events.year: 1663 – Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.
Events.html: 1663 – Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.

Events.year: 1709 – Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava, thus effectively ending Sweden's status as a major power in Europe.
Events.html: 1709 – Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava, thus effectively ending Sweden's status as a major power in Europe.

Events.year: 1716 – The Battle of Dynekilen forces Sweden to abandon its invasion of Norway.
Events.html: 1716 – The Battle of Dynekilen forces Sweden to abandon its invasion of Norway.

Events.year: 1730 – An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.
Events.html: 1730 – An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.

Events.year: 1758 – French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.
Events.html: 1758 – French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.

Events.year: 1760 – British forces defeat French forces in the last naval battle in New France.
Events.html: 1760 – British forces defeat French forces in the last naval battle in New France.

Events.year: 1775 – The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies of North America.
Events.html: 1775 – The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies of North America.

Events.year: 1776 – Church bells (possibly including the Liberty Bell) are rung after John Nixon delivers the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence of the United States.
Events.html: 1776 – Church bells (possibly including the Liberty Bell) are rung after John Nixon delivers the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence of the United States.

links.title: Declaration of Independence of the United States

Events.year: 1808 – Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.
Events.html: 1808 – Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.

Events.year: 1822 – Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.
Events.html: 1822 – Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.

Events.year: 1853 – The Perry Expedition arrives in Edo Bay with a treaty requesting trade.
Events.html: 1853 – The Perry Expedition arrives in Edo Bay with a treaty requesting trade.

Events.year: 1859 – King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden-Norway.
Events.html: 1859 – King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden-Norway.

Events.year: 1864 – Ikedaya Incident: The Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.
Events.html: 1864 – Ikedaya Incident: The Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.

Events.year: 1874 – The Mounties begin their March West.
Events.html: 1874 – The Mounties begin their March West.

Events.year: 1876 – White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.
Events.html: 1876 – White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.

Events.year: 1879 – Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.
Events.html: 1879 – Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.

Events.year: 1889 – The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.
Events.html: 1889 – The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.

Events.year: 1892 – St. John's, Newfoundland is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.
Events.html: 1892 – St. John's, Newfoundland is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.

Events.year: 1898 – The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.
Events.html: 1898 – The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.

Events.year: 1912 – Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.
Events.html: 1912 – Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.

Events.year: 1932 – The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.
Events.html: 1932 – The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.

Events.year: 1933 – The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.
Events.html: 1933 – The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.

links.title: South Africa national rugby union team

Events.year: 1937 – Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.
Events.html: 1937 – Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.

Events.year: 1947 – Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico in what became known as the Roswell UFO incident.
Events.html: 1947 – Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico in what became known as the Roswell UFO incident.

Events.year: 1948 – The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).
Events.html: 1948 – The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).

Events.year: 1960 – Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.
Events.html: 1960 – Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.

Events.year: 1962 – Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.
Events.html: 1962 – Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.

Events.year: 1966 – King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.
Events.html: 1966 – King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.

Events.year: 1968 – The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.
Events.html: 1968 – The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.

Events.year: 1970 – Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.
Events.html: 1970 – Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.

links.title: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975

Events.year: 1972 – Israeli Mossad assassinate Palestinian writer Ghassan Kanafani.
Events.html: 1972 – Israeli Mossad assassinate Palestinian writer Ghassan Kanafani.

Events.year: 1980 – The inaugural 1980 State of Origin game is won by Queensland who defeat New South Wales 20-10 at Lang Park.
Events.html: 1980 – The inaugural 1980 State of Origin game is won by Queensland who defeat New South Wales 20-10 at Lang Park.

Events.year: 1982 – Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.
Events.html: 1982 – Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.

Events.year: 1988 – The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.
Events.html: 1988 – The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.

Events.year: 1994 – Kim Jong-il begins to assume supreme leadership of North Korea upon the death of his father, Kim Il-sung.
